column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Incheon International Airport
#Text=Incheon International Airport ( 인천국제공항 ) ( ICN ) is South Korea 's largest airport , its main international gateway , and the main airport of Seoul .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Incheon International Airport was built to the west of Seoul and opened in 2001 , taking over from Seoul Gimpo airport as the nation 's international hub .
#Text=It has comprehensive connections to the South Korean capital , and is frequently rated in the top three airports in the world .
#Text=The terminal buildings are architecturally very impressive , and are a pleasure to look at , even if you are not flying .
#Text=The airport is beautiful , meticulously clean and well maintained .
#Text=There 's plenty to keep one occupied while waiting .
#Text=The nearby city of Incheon is also a significant center of industry .
#Text=A second terminal was opened in time for the 2018 Winter Olympics .
#Text=Flights
#Text=Incheon is the main international hub for both Korean Air and Asiana , with many airlines flying from North America , Europe , Africa , Australasia and Asia .

#Text=The vast majority of domestic Korean flights , as well as some international flights to China , Japan and Taiwan , are still handled by Seoul Gimpo airport which is a short AREX train journey from Incheon airport .
#Text=There are a limited number of direct flights from Seoul Incheon to both Busan 's Gimhae International Airport and Daegu every day .
#Text=These cost slightly more than the corresponding flights from Gimpo , but they are much more convenient if you arrive on an international flight .
#Text=These are actually treated as international connections , and you will pass immigration later at your destination .
#Text=Terminal 1 : All airlines not in Terminal 2

#Text=Terminal 2 : Air France , Delta , KLM , Korean Air ( original members ) , Aeromexico , Alitalia , China Airlines , Garuda Indonesia , XiamenAir , Czech Airlines and Aeroflot ( from October 28 , 2018 ) -
#Text=other Skyteam members will move after further expansion
#Text=A'REX ( Airport train )

#Text=The A'REX train link connects the airport to Seoul Station ( for further connections to KTX high-speed services ) and Gimpo Airport ( most domestic flights ) , operating from 05:20 until 00:00 .
#Text=There are express services and all-stop services .

#Text=Express services to the city ( every half hour ) takes 43 minutes ( Terminal 1 to Seoul Station ) or 51 minutes ( Terminal 2 to Seoul Station ) and cost ₩8,500/₩7,000 ( adult/child ) ( with WiFi available on board ) .
#Text=There is a discounted fare of ₩7,500 for travelers taking a roundtrip within 15 days , groups of three and passengers of certain airlines ( see here for more details and discounts ) .
#Text=All-stop services ( every 6 minutes as part of the Seoul Subway system ) take an hour and cost ₩4,150 from T1/₩4,750 from T2 .
#Text=Many times it 's faster to take the All-Stop than the Express train .
#Text=The All-Stop and the Express train leave from different platforms and have separate ticket booths .
#Text=Travelers coming from Seoul Station to Incheon need to enter the subway area with a T-money or single entry ticket to access the AREX platforms .
#Text=The cost of the subway ticket is refunded when buying an AREX ticket .
#Text=The All-Stop train requires a T-money card or single entry ticket , which require cash .
#Text=The Express train can be paid with credit card as well .
#Text=If you are flying with Korean Air , Asiana Airlines , T'Way Air and Jeju Air
#Text=you can check into your flight at Seoul Station before you get on the AREX Express train if you are there at least 3 hours before your departure time .
#Text=Immigration officers are also on hand to stamp your passport , which means you are processed and can quickly go through the Diplomatic Departures entrance in Incheon Airport .
#Text=Look for description of City Airport terminal below .
#Text=Travel time to Gimpo Airport is 28/35 minutes , with both services charging ₩3,100 , making this the fastest and cheapest option for inter-airport transfer as well .
#Text=KTX
#Text=Korea 's high speed rail service ( KTX ) used to run to and from Incheon Airport , connecting directly to Seoul station , Daejeon , Daegu , Ulsan and Busan .
#Text=But this connection will no longer be operated from 2018 .
#Text=To use KTX to go to other cities , use AREX and go to Seoul Station or Bus No. 6770 ( ₩15000 ) to Gwangmyeong Station .
#Text=Bus 6770 is operated by Korail , and there is a ₩3000 discount for the combined ticket for KTX and the bus .
#Text=City Airport Terminal at Gwangmyeong Station can be faster than going to Seoul station , so look for description below .
#Text=Maglev train
#Text=In February 2016 , Incheon opened a new maglev line to the area around the airport and adjacent Yongyu Island .
#Text=It begins at the airport A'REX station and ends at Yongyu Station , stopping at the airport administration building , long-term parking lots , and a couple of other places along the way .

#Text=With a maximum speed of , it is not exactly in the same class as the Shanghai Maglev , but may still be interesting to tourists wishing to ride a maglev for the first time or those in town for an event on Yongyu .
#Text=The train runs every 15 minutes from 09:00 and 18:00 , and fares are free for the first few years after opening .
#Text=By bus
#Text=When traveling into Seoul with a lot of luggage or are heading to southern parts of Seoul ( eg . Gangnam ) then the airport buses are a very good option .
#Text=Limousine buses ( ₩15,000 to/from city for one way , ₩6,500 to/from Gimpo Airport ( domestic flight ) )
#Text=travel directly to major areas and big hotels in Seoul , while public buses ( ₩8,000-9.000 ) will take you to major transit hubs .
#Text=If you 're visiting for the first time , it 's worth paying a bit extra for the limousine bus .

#Text=For either bus type , consult the big maps or staff to figure out which route best suits your needs ; you can then find the shuttles outside 1st floor arrivals ( if possible get this information from your hotel before arriving ) .
#Text=Or simply , walk out and ask the many ticket sellers ( they are wearing vests )
#Text=which bus goes to your hotel because if it 's a popular one or in a popular area , they 'll surely know which you 'll need .
#Text=It 's best to buy tickets at any of the ticket gates near the bus arrival area but you can also pay the fare using won or a T-Money card if you have one .
#Text=The limousine bus drivers are extremely friendly but do n't count on them knowing too much English .
#Text=There are maps inside the buses letting passengers know which stops are upcoming and these are also announced in Korean and English .
#Text=Pressing any of the red buttons inside signals to the driver you want off at the next stop .
#Text=You can purchase and recharge a T-Money card at the GS25 store which is located at the end of the arrivals area , next to " International Arrivals F " exit .
#Text=If you have a late flight and plan on getting into Seoul via bus , make sure you get out to the curb as soon as you can .
#Text=The last buses run shortly after the last flights land .
#Text=If you miss your bus , you 'll be stuck paying for a taxi , as the trains will stop running too .
#Text=There are also inter-city and express bus to cities other than Seoul .
